paragraphs.title: Zeppelin Demo Notebook 2
paragraphs.text:
%md
Demonstrate loading, querying, visualizing, and saving the GroupLens MovieLens Latest Datasets.
The latest datasets are available to download on [GroupLens](https://grouplens.org/datasets/movielens/).

MovieLens Datasets Specifications:
- Small: __100,000__ ratings and 3,600 tag applications applied to 9,000 movies by 600 users. Last updated 9/2018.
- Full: __27,000,000__ ratings and 1,100,000 tag applications applied to 58,000 movies by 280,000 users. Includes tag genome data with 14 million relevance scores across 1,100 tags. Last updated 9/2018.

msg.data:
Demonstrate loading, querying, visualizing, and saving the GroupLens MovieLens Latest Datasets.
The latest datasets are available to download on GroupLens.

MovieLens Datasets Specifications:
- Small: 100,000 ratings and 3,600 tag applications applied to 9,000 movies by 600 users. Last updated 9/2018.
- Full: 27,000,000 ratings and 1,100,000 tag applications applied to 58,000 movies by 280,000 users. Includes tag genome data with 14 million relevance scores across 1,100 tags. Last updated 9/2018.

paragraphs.title: Import Python Packages
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
from pyspark import SparkFiles
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, IntegerType, DateType

paragraphs.title: Load MovieLens Data from GroupLens
paragraphs.text:
%sh
#change me - choices: or ml-latest-small (100k) or ml-latest (27MM)
DIR="ml-latest"

if [ -d $DIR ]; then
    echo "$DIR exist"
else 
    wget -nv http://files.grouplens.org/datasets/movielens/$DIR.zip -O $DIR.zip && unzip $DIR.zip
fi

# copy from local file system (/var/lib/zeppelin) to the destination file system (/user/zeppelin)
hadoop fs -put -f $DIR/movies.csv $DIR/ratings.csv .
hadoop fs -ls -h .

paragraphs.title: Load Movies CSV Data into DataFrame
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
moviesDF = spark.read \
    .format("csv") \
    .option("header", "true") \
    .option("delimiter", ",") \
    .option("inferSchema", "true") \
    .load("movies.csv")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % moviesDF.count())
print("DataFrame schema: %s" % moviesDF)
moviesDF.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Load Ratings CSV Data into DataFrame
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
ratingsDF = spark.read \
    .format("csv") \
    .option("header", "true") \
    .option("delimiter", ",") \
    .option("inferSchema", "true") \
    .load("ratings.csv")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % ratingsDF.count())
print("DataFrame schema: %s" % ratingsDF)
ratingsDF.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Save Data in CSV- and Parquet-formats to S3
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
# change me
ZEPPELIN_DEMO_BUCKET=z.input("ZEPPELIN_DEMO_BUCKET","gstafford-emr-demo-us-east1")
RECORD_SIZE=z.select("RECORD_SIZE", [("100k","100k"), ("27MM","27MM")])
print("ZEPPELIN_DEMO_BUCKET:", ZEPPELIN_DEMO_BUCKET)
print("RECORD_SIZE:", RECORD_SIZE)

paragraphs.title: Save Data in CSV- and Parquet-formats to S3
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
BUCKET_PATH="s3://" + ZEPPELIN_DEMO_BUCKET + "/data/"
moviesDF.write.parquet(BUCKET_PATH + "movies-csv-" + RECORD_SIZE, mode="overwrite")
ratingsDF.write.parquet(BUCKET_PATH + "ratings-csv-" + RECORD_SIZE, mode="overwrite")

moviesDF.write.parquet(BUCKET_PATH + "movies-parquet-" + RECORD_SIZE, mode="overwrite")
ratingsDF.write.parquet(BUCKET_PATH + "ratings-parquet-" + RECORD_SIZE, mode="overwrite")

paragraphs.title: Load Parquet-format Movies Data from S3
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
moviesDF = spark.read.parquet(BUCKET_PATH + "movies-parquet-" + RECORD_SIZE)
print("DataFrame rows: %d" % moviesDF.count())

paragraphs.title: Load Parquet-format Ratings Data from S3
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
ratingsDF = spark.read.parquet(BUCKET_PATH + "ratings-parquet-" + RECORD_SIZE)
print("DataFrame rows: %d" % ratingsDF.count())

paragraphs.title: Create Temporary View of Movies Data and Query
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

moviesDF.createOrReplaceTempView("ratings")

moviesDF = spark.sql("SELECT movieId, title, genres " +
                      "FROM movies " +
                      "ORDER BY title")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % moviesDF.count())
moviesDF.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Create Temporary View of Ratings Data and Query
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark

ratingsDF.createOrReplaceTempView("ratings")

ratingsDF = spark.sql("SELECT movieId, rating, userId, CAST(timestamp as timestamp) as dateTime " +
                      "FROM ratings " +
                      "ORDER BY movieId, rating, userId")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % ratingsDF.count())
ratingsDF.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Replace Temporary View with New Query
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
ratingsDF.createOrReplaceTempView("ratings")
moviesDF.createOrReplaceTempView("movies")

topMoviesDF = spark.sql("SELECT m.title, AVG(r.rating) as avg_rating, COUNT(r.rating) as cnt_ratings " +
                        "FROM ratings r " +
                        "JOIN movies m ON (r.movieId = m.movieId) " +
                        "GROUP BY m.title " +
                        "ORDER BY avg_rating DESC, cnt_ratings DESC, m.title ASC")
                        
# topMoviesDF = topMoviesDF.filter(topMoviesDF.cnt_ratings >= 25)

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % moviesDF.count())
print("Top 10 Movies")
topMoviesDF.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Native Zeppelin Visualization Based on SQL Query
paragraphs.text:
%sql
WITH tmp_table AS (
    SELECT m.title, AVG(r.rating) as avg_rating, COUNT(r.rating) as cnt_ratings
    FROM ratings r
    JOIN movies m ON (r.movieId = m.movieId)
    GROUP BY m.title)
    
SELECT title, CAST(avg_rating AS DECIMAL(38,2)), cnt_ratings
FROM tmp_table
WHERE avg_rating >= ${avgRatingMin=4} AND cnt_ratings >= ${RatingsMin=2}
ORDER BY avg_rating ASC, cnt_ratings DESC, title ASC
LIMIT 25
